intro: Eucrypta torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's eucrypta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a short, branched stem. Eucrypta torreyi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
